alert.note: Alert for Arthur; Garden; Grant; Sheridan; Western Cherry (Nebraska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 10 at 6:44PM CDT by NWS NorthPlatte
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of northwestern Arthur, southwestern Cherry, western Grant, northern Garden and southern Sheridan Counties through 630 PM MDT... At 544 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 16 miles northeast of Wild Horse Butte to near Antioch to 16 miles west of Crescent Lake National Wildlife Refuge. Movement was east-southeast at 50 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Ellsworth, Ashby, Antioch, Crescent Lake National Wildlife Refuge, Dipping Vat Meadow, Swede Lake, Deer Lake, Britton Lake, Miles Lake, Richardson Lake, Mumper, Wickson Lake, Diamond Lake, Herman Lake, Adams Flats, Krause Lake, Watson Lake, Rackett, Patterson Lake and Finnegan Lake. This includes the following highways... Highway 250 between mile markers 1 and 27. Highway 2 between mile markers 100 and 144. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. These storms may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service.

area.areaDesc: Arthur; Garden; Grant; Sheridan; Western Cherry
